title: Installing GDAL on Windows with rgeowheels
text: Installing geospatial Python packages Windows can challenging due complex binary dependencies need pre-compiled wheels. rgeowheels package dramatically simplifies process providing convenient access Christoph Gohlke’s curated collection pre-compiled geospatial wheels, especially GDAL related libraries. Note: vignette demonstrates Windows-specific workflows. code examples execute successfully Windows systems, rgeowheels provides pre-compiled wheels specifically Windows architectures (win32, win_amd64, win_arm64). vignette demonstrates : Create activate virtual environment Python development Detect available Python versions environment Use rgeowheels install geospatial wheels (like GDAL) environment Verify installation works reticulate workflow particularly useful : Continuous Integration (CI) workflows need reproducible Python environments Reticulate-based R packages require specific geospatial dependencies Development workflows want isolated Python environments per project

what: Getting Started: Creating a Virtual Environment
title: Installing GDAL on Windows with rgeowheels
text: recommended approach create dedicated Python virtual environment project. isolates project dependencies system Python projects.

previous_headings: Getting Started: Creating a Virtual Environment
what: Using reticulate to Create a Venv
title: Installing GDAL on Windows with rgeowheels
text: already Python installed, can create virtual environment directly R using reticulate: Alternatively, create venv command line:
code: library(reticulate)  # Create a virtual environment in your project directory venv_path <- file.path(getwd(), ".venv") virtualenv_create(venv_path, python = Sys.which("python"))  # Activate the virtual environment use_virtualenv(venv_path, required = TRUE) # Windows Command Prompt python -m venv .venv .venv\Scripts\activate.bat  # Or PowerShell python -m venv .venv .venv\Scripts\Activate.ps1  # Or using conda conda create -n myenv python=3.11 conda activate myenv

title: Installing GDAL on Windows with rgeowheels
text: installing wheels, ’s helpful understand Python environments available. detect_python_envs() function scans system virtual environments conda environments: can also check Python version specific environment:
code: library(rgeowheels) #> rgeowheels 0.1.0 #>  - Cached release asset list not found, run `list_rgeowheels_assets()` to begin.  # Discover available Python environments envs <- detect_python_envs() envs #>          type                                                    path version #> python system C:\\HOSTED~1\\windows\\Python\\314~1.0\\x64\\python.exe    3.14 #>        active #> python   TRUE # Get the version of the currently active Python current_version <- detect_python_version() current_version  # Or check a specific Python binary (wrapped in try to handle venv if not present) venv_python <- file.path(".venv", "Scripts", "python.exe")  # Windows if (file.exists(venv_python)) {   venv_version <- detect_python_version(venv_python)   venv_version }

title: Installing GDAL on Windows with rgeowheels
text: Python environment set activated, installing GDAL straightforward:

title: Installing GDAL on Windows with rgeowheels
text: simplest approach use pyversion = "auto" automatically detect Python version match available wheels: : Detect active Python version (e.g., “3.11”) Display message: "Auto-selected Python 3.11 GDAL" Find download matching GDAL wheel Install via pip
code: library(rgeowheels) library(reticulate)  # Ensure your virtual environment is active use_virtualenv(".venv", required = TRUE)  # Install GDAL - automatically detects Python version install_wheel("GDAL", version = "latest", pyversion = "auto")

title: Installing GDAL on Windows with rgeowheels
text: want use auto-detection suppress informational message (useful scripts CI), three options: Option 1: Set environment variable Option 2: Set R option Option 3: Explicitly specify Python version
code: Sys.setenv(R_RGEOWHEELS_QUIET_AUTO = "TRUE") install_wheel("GDAL", pyversion = "auto") options(rgeowheels.quiet_auto = TRUE) install_wheel("GDAL", pyversion = "auto") # Once you know the version, you can pin it explicitly (message is suppressed) install_wheel("GDAL", pyversion = "3.11")

title: Installing GDAL on Windows with rgeowheels
text: need specific version GDAL specific Python version:
code: install_wheel(   package = "GDAL",   version = "3.8.4",        # Specific GDAL version   pyversion = "3.11",       # Specific Python version   architecture = "win_amd64" # Windows 64-bit (default) )

title: Installing GDAL on Windows with rgeowheels
text: installing, can see versions available:
code: # List all available wheels assets <- list_rgeowheels_assets()  # Filter for GDAL gdal_wheels <- assets[assets$package == "GDAL", ] print(gdal_wheels[, c("package", "version", "pyversion", "architecture")]) #>      package version pyversion architecture #> 478     GDAL  3.10.1      3.10        win32 #> 479     GDAL  3.10.1      3.10    win_amd64 #> 480     GDAL  3.10.1      3.11 629     GDAL   3.9.2       3.9    win_amd64 #> 630     GDAL   3.9.2      3.10    win_amd64 #> 759     GDAL   3.8.4      3.10        win32 #> 760     GDAL   3.8.4      3.10    win_amd64 #> 761     GDAL   3.8.4      3.11        win32 #> 762     GDAL   3.8.4      3.11    win_amd64 #> 763     GDAL   3.8.4      3.11    win_arm64 #> 764     GDAL   3.8.4      3.12        win32 #> 765     GDAL   3.8.4   3.8.2       3.9        win32 #> 889     GDAL   3.8.2       3.9    win_amd64 #> 890     GDAL   3.8.2      3.10    win_amd64 #> 1001    GDAL   3.7.3      3.10        win32 #> 1002    GDAL   3.7.3 what: Complete Workflow Example: CI/CD Integration with Reticulate
title: Installing GDAL on Windows with rgeowheels
text: ’s complete workflow combining reticulate venv creation rgeowheels installation:
code: library(reticulate) library(rgeowheels)  # 1. Create a virtual environment venv_path <- file.path(getwd(), ".venv") if (!dir.exists(venv_path)) {   virtualenv_create(venv_path, python = Sys.which("python")) }  # 2. Activate it use_virtualenv(venv_path, required = TRUE)  # 3. Detect available Python in this venv detect_python_envs()  # 4. Install geospatial wheels install_wheel("GDAL", version = "latest", pyversion = "auto") install_wheel("rasterio", version = "latest", pyversion = "auto") install_wheel("fiona", version = "latest", pyversion = "auto")  # 5. Verify installations py_run_string("from osgeo import gdal; print(f'GDAL {gdal.__version__}')") py_run_string("import rasterio; print(f'Rasterio {rasterio.__version__}')")  # 6. Use Python objects in R py_run_string(" import rasterio from rasterio.plot import show # ... your geospatial Python code here ")

title: Installing GDAL on Windows with rgeowheels
text: see error like: means GDAL wheels aren’t available Python 3.9. two options: Update Python: Upgrade supported version (3.10, 3.11, 3.12) Explicit version: Specify available Python version
code: could not find wheels for:      - 'GDAL' version 'latest' for Python '3.9' (win_amd64)      Available Python versions for 'GDAL' (win_amd64): 3.10, 3.11, 3.12 # Upgrade your venv to Python 3.11 virtualenv_create(".venv_311", python = "C:/Python311/python.exe") use_virtualenv(".venv_311")  # Or explicitly request 3.11 install_wheel("GDAL", pyversion = "3.11")

title: Installing GDAL on Windows with rgeowheels
text: detect_python_version() fails “Python binary found”, ensure: Python installed PATH: Sys.("python") virtual environment activated: use_virtualenv(".venv") ’ve set Python path explicitly:
code: set_rgeowheels_python("C:/path/to/venv/Scripts/python.exe") detect_python_version()

title: Installing GDAL on Windows with rgeowheels
text: multiple Python installations, can explicitly set one rgeowheels uses:
code: # Set for this session set_rgeowheels_python("C:/Python311/python.exe")  # Or via environment variable (persists across R sessions) Sys.setenv(R_RGEOWHEELS_PYTHON = "C:/Python311/python.exe")

title: Installing GDAL on Windows with rgeowheels
text: ’s sample abbreviated YAML configuration using rgeowheels GitHub Actions CI:
code: name: Test with GDAL  on: [push, pull_request]  jobs:   test:     runs-on: windows-latest     strategy:       matrix:         python-version: ['3.10', '3.11', '3.12']         r-version: ['4.2', '4.3']      steps:       - uses: actions/checkout@v4              - uses: actions/setup-python@v5         with:           python-version: ${{ matrix.python-version }}              - uses: r-lib/actions/setup-r@v2         with:           r-version: ${{ matrix.r-version }}              - name: Install R packages         run: |           install.packages(c("reticulate", "rgeowheels"))         shell: Rscript {0}              - name: Install Python geospatial wheels         run: |           library(rgeowheels)           library(reticulate)           use_python(Sys.which("python"))           install_wheel("GDAL", pyversion = "auto")           install_wheel("rasterio", pyversion = "auto")         shell: Rscript {0}              - name: Run tests         run: |           Rscript -e 'tinytest::test_all()'

title: Installing GDAL on Windows with rgeowheels
text: rgeowheels workflow provides significant advantages Windows: Speed: Pre-compiled wheels install seconds (vs. compilation time) Reliability: compiler requirements build failures Reproducibility: Exact versions specified matched consistently Simplicity: One-line installation via install_wheel() CI/CD-friendly: Works seamlessly headless environments

title: Installing GDAL on Windows with rgeowheels
text: combining rgeowheels reticulate’s virtual environment management, can create reproducible, isolated Python development environments Windows geospatial dependencies installed seconds. especially valuable : Complex R packages bridge geospatial Python libraries Data science workflows requiring R Python geospatial tools CI/CD pipelines consistent environments critical Teams working Windows systems without compiler infrastructure information, see ?install_wheel, ?detect_python_version, ?detect_python_envs.

what: Convenient Access to Python Wheel Packages Prepared for Windows
title: Convenient Access to Python Wheel Packages Prepared for Windows
text: Downloads pre-compiled Windows ‘wheel’ files (.whl) Python geospatial packages https://github.com/cgohlke/geospatial-wheels. unofficial binary installers Python geospatial libraries Windows prepared Christoph Gohlke. Wheels various packages, Python versions, architectures made available via GitHub releases, providing ability revert prior versions needed. Key Features: Automatic Python Version Detection: Use pyversion = "auto" automatically detect match Python version Virtual Environment Support: Works seamlessly Python virtual environments conda environments Environment Discovery: Discover available Python environments detect_python_envs() CI/CD Friendly: Perfect GitHub Actions CI workflows Windows Simplified Installation: Install complex geospatial libraries seconds

title: Convenient Access to Python Wheel Packages Prepared for Windows
text: can install development version {rgeowheels} like :
code: # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("brownag/rgeowheels")

title: Convenient Access to Python Wheel Packages Prepared for Windows
text: simplest way install wheel use automatic Python version detection: details, see vignette: vignette("installing-gdal-windows")
code: library(rgeowheels)  install_wheel("GDAL", pyversion = "auto")

title: Convenient Access to Python Wheel Packages Prepared for Windows
code: library(rgeowheels) #> rgeowheels 0.1.0 #>  - Latest cached release: 2025-10-26 #>  <https://github.com/cgohlke/geospatial-wheels/releases/tag/v2025.10.25>  # See all available wheels assets <- list_rgeowheels_assets()  # Filter for specific package gdal_wheels <- subset(assets, package == "gdal") head(gdal_wheels[, c("package", "version", "pyversion", "architecture")]) #>    package version pyversion architecture #> 61    gdal  3.11.4      3.11        win32 #> 62    gdal  3.11.4      3.11    win_amd64 #> 63    gdal  3.11.4      3.11    win_arm64 #> 64    gdal  3.11.4      3.12        win32 #> 65    gdal  3.11.4      3.12    win_amd64 #> 66    gdal  3.11.4      3.12    win_arm64

title: Convenient Access to Python Wheel Packages Prepared for Windows
code: library(rgeowheels)  # Auto-detect your Python version and return URL install_wheel("gdal", pyversion = "auto", url_only = TRUE) #> Auto-selected Python 3.12 for gdal #> [1] "https://github.com/cgohlke/geospatial-wheels/releases/download/v2025.10.25/gdal-3.11.4-cp312-cp312-win_amd64.whl"

what: Install with automatic Python version detection
title: Convenient Access to Python Wheel Packages Prepared for Windows
code: # Auto-detect your Python version and install install_wheel("gdal", pyversion = "auto")  # Suppress the info message Sys.setenv(R_RGEOWHEELS_QUIET_AUTO = "TRUE") install_wheel("rasterio", pyversion = "auto")  # Or specify Python explicitly (suppresses message) install_wheel("fiona", pyversion = "3.11")

title: Convenient Access to Python Wheel Packages Prepared for Windows
code: library(rgeowheels)  # Find available Python environments detect_python_envs()

title: Convenient Access to Python Wheel Packages Prepared for Windows
code: # Latest version of GDAL, latest cpython, available for win_amd64 architecture install_wheel("GDAL", url_only = TRUE)  # Specific GDAL version for Python 3.10 install_wheel("rasterio", version = "1.3.4", pyversion = "3.10", url_only = TRUE)  # Most recent version of rasterio for Python 3.8 install_wheel("rasterio", pyversion = "3.8", url_only = TRUE)

title: Convenient Access to Python Wheel Packages Prepared for Windows
code: library(reticulate) library(rgeowheels)  # Create and activate a virtual environment venv_path <- file.path(getwd(), ".venv") virtualenv_create(venv_path, python = Sys.which("python")) use_virtualenv(venv_path)  # Install geospatial packages install_wheel("GDAL", pyversion = "auto") install_wheel("rasterio", pyversion = "auto")  # Verify installation py_run_string("from osgeo import gdal; print(f'GDAL {gdal.__version__}')")

title: Detect Available Python Environments — detect_python_envs
text: Scan system available Python environments including virtual environments, conda environments, system Python.

title: Detect Available Python Environments — detect_python_envs
code: detect_python_envs(include_system = TRUE, project_root = getwd())

title: Detect Available Python Environments — detect_python_envs
text: include_system Include system Python results? Default: TRUE project_root Directory scan project-local virtual environments. Default: current working directory

title: Detect Available Python Environments — detect_python_envs
text: data.frame columns: type (venv/conda/system), path, version, active

title: Detect Available Python Environments — detect_python_envs
text: Scans virtual environments following project-local directories (order): .venv, venv, .virtualenv, env Also detects active virtual environment via VIRTUAL_ENV environment variable active conda environment via CONDA_DEFAULT_ENV.

title: Detect Available Python Environments — detect_python_envs
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{   detect_python_envs()   detect_python_envs(project_root = "/path/to/project") } # }

title: Detect Python Version — detect_python_version
text: Extract major.minor Python version Python binary.

title: Detect Python Version — detect_python_version
code: detect_python_version(python = get_rgeowheels_python())

title: Detect Python Version — detect_python_version
text: python Path Python executable. Default: get_rgeowheels_python()

title: Detect Python Version — detect_python_version
text: character Python version major.minor format (e.g., "3.11")

title: Detect Python Version — detect_python_version
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{   detect_python_version()   detect_python_version("/path/to/venv/bin/python") } # }

what: Install Python Wheels From 'geospatial-wheels' Repository — install_wheel
title: Install Python Wheels From 'geospatial-wheels' Repository — install_wheel
text: Install Python Wheels 'geospatial-wheels' Repository

title: Install Python Wheels From 'geospatial-wheels' Repository — install_wheel
code: install_wheel(   package,   version = "latest",   pyversion = "latest",   architecture = "win_amd64",   python = get_rgeowheels_python(),   destdir = tempdir(),   url_only = FALSE,   download_only = FALSE )

title: Install Python Wheels From 'geospatial-wheels' Repository — install_wheel
text: package Python package name install. e.g. "rasterio" version Python package version install. Default "latest" determines latest version available asset list (considers pyversion set). pyversion Python version install package . Default "latest" determines latest version available asset list. Use "auto" detect Python version specified Python binary. architecture Target architecture wheel install. Default "win_amd64", alternatives include "win_arm64" "win32". python Path Python executable use install. Default: get_rgeowheels_python() destdir Destination directory downloaded wheel file. Default: tempdir() url_only Return URL .whl file without downloading? Default: FALSE download_only Download .whl file without attempting install? Default: FALSE

title: Install Python Wheels From 'geospatial-wheels' Repository — install_wheel
text: Called side effects (download install Python wheel). Returns character containing path .whl file url_only=TRUE download_only=TRUE.

title: List assets available from
text: List assets available "geospatial-wheels" repository

title: List assets available from
code: list_rgeowheels_assets(   release = NULL,   update_cache = FALSE,   check_freshness = FALSE )

title: List assets available from
text: release Specify custom release list assets . Default: NULL update_cache Force update wheel download index? Default: FALSE check_freshness Check cached data latest release? Default: FALSE

title: List assets available from
text: data.frame containing  package, version, pyversion, architecture metadata asset release.

title: Refresh rgeowheels cache — refresh_rgeowheels_cache
text: Force update cached wheel download index latest GitHub release.

title: Refresh rgeowheels cache — refresh_rgeowheels_cache
code: refresh_rgeowheels_cache()

title: Refresh rgeowheels cache — refresh_rgeowheels_cache
text: Called side effects. Updates local cache latest available wheels.

what: rgeowheels: Pre-compiled Python Geospatial Wheels for Windows — rgeowheels-package
title: rgeowheels: Pre-compiled Python Geospatial Wheels for Windows — rgeowheels-package
text: Access install pre-compiled Python geospatial wheels Christoph Gohlke's repository. Automatically detects Python versions simplifies installation complex packages like GDAL Windows.

title: rgeowheels: Pre-compiled Python Geospatial Wheels for Windows — rgeowheels-package
text: install_wheel(): Download install wheels automatic Python version detection list_rgeowheels_assets(): List available wheels geospatial-wheels repository detect_python_version(): Extract Python version binary detect_python_envs(): Discover available Python environments (venv/conda/system) get_rgeowheels_python() / set_rgeowheels_python(): Manage Python binary path

title: rgeowheels: Pre-compiled Python Geospatial Wheels for Windows — rgeowheels-package
text: Use pyversion = "auto" install_wheel() automatically detect match current Python version. Suppress informational messages : Environment variable: Sys.setenv(R_RGEOWHEELS_QUIET_AUTO = "TRUE") R option: options(rgeowheels.quiet_auto = TRUE) Explicit version specification: pyversion = "3.11"

title: rgeowheels: Pre-compiled Python Geospatial Wheels for Windows — rgeowheels-package
text: Full support Python virtual environments conda environments. Use detect_python_envs() discover environments, activate reticulate:
code: library(reticulate) use_virtualenv(".venv") install_wheel("GDAL", pyversion = "auto")

what: Get or Set Python Path — set_rgeowheels_python
title: Get or Set Python Path — set_rgeowheels_python
text: Set path Python binary used run installation commands. May system virtual/conda environment.

title: Get or Set Python Path — set_rgeowheels_python
code: set_rgeowheels_python(x)  get_rgeowheels_python()

title: Get or Set Python Path — set_rgeowheels_python
text: x Path python python3 binary.

title: Get or Set Python Path — set_rgeowheels_python
text: character Value option "rgeowheels.python", , set, value system environment variable "R_RGEOWHEELS_PYTHON". neither set, result Sys.("python") (Sys.("python3") former fails).

title: rgeowheels 0.1.0
text: Add automatic Python version detection pyversion = "auto" Add detect_python_version() extract Python version binary Add detect_python_envs() discover available Python environments Add message suppression auto-detection via environment variable R options Add improved error messages showing available Python versions Add comprehensive vignette installing GDAL Windows reticulate integration Add refresh_rgeowheels_cache() explicit cache updates Add informative GitHub API rate limit error messages reset times Add smart retry logic httr::RETRY server errors Add cache freshness checking 1-hour result caching

title: rgeowheels 0.0.5
text: Rename list_assets() list_rgeowheels_assets()

title: rgeowheels 0.0.4
text: Add basic tests core functions

title: rgeowheels 0.0.3
text: Remove rvest dependency; use jsonlite base R instead Consolidate R source files

title: rgeowheels 0.0.2
text: Add get_rgeowheels_python() set_rgeowheels_python() Python binary management

title: rgeowheels 0.0.1
text: Initial release Download install wheels geospatial-wheels repository install_wheel() function downloading/installing wheels list_assets() function (renamed list_rgeowheels_assets() 0.0.5) Support multiple architectures (win32, win_amd64, win_arm64)
